i made a spur of the moment decision and
decided to buy a 16 year old land rover
defender said to be one of the least
reliable cars on the market and took on
the challenge of converting it into an
expedition vehicle of my dreams
over the following six weeks my uncle
helped me create an actual tiny home
inside my 4x4 we built the furniture we
built storage we built a bed we built
everything pretty much from scratch and
then
i set off from poland
my idea was to drive to georgia keep in
mind i have zero experience of mechanics
or off-roading and i was going to be
alone for the vast majority of the time
and i didn't even know whether i would
like over landing to be completely
honest i just kind of assumed that i
would so that was a bit risky
i spent my very first night of the trip
stuck in a storm and torrential rain in
the mountains of the czech republic i
have to say
it's a little bit creepy out here
i had made the classic mistake of
driving in the dark which i quickly
learned was not something i should ever
do again and yet i kept doing it over
and over again throughout my trip after
the czech republic i drove straight to
croatia where i got my very first taste
of proper wild camping in my truck i
also went hiking for two days and that
was so beautiful i didn't see a single
soul for an entire day of trekking in
the mountains it was
magic and then after croatia i wanted to
drive straight through bosnia to get to
the balkans however that's not quite
what happened because i got stopped by a
police officer in the middle of the
mountains for speeding apparently i
don't think i was actually speeding he
said he wanted 50 euros
because i had crossed the speed limit by
10 kilometers an hour i gave him 25 and
he let me go i assumed that was a bribe
so once i got to leave bosnia i went to

about a week where i had probably my
most dramatic and definitely scariest
experience of the entire trip mind you
this happened in the first two weeks of
my four-month trip i was staying at a
campsite in montenegro and one day in
the morning i was minding my own
business making a coffee and suddenly
i got attacked by a vicious cow i'm not
kidding i thought i was gonna die and
guess what the surgeon's reaction was
when i told him what had happened that a

all the nurses and all the assistant
doctors as you would
it's ridiculous so after recovering for

in albania honestly i just wanted to

throughout the entire trip i had really

they're there they're fixed which meant
